author: {'steamid': '76561198157493201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1475594431}
review:
2 hours and you can get the achievements. 
Bought it for the pun.
It's like making tea with your armpits - you have no control.

Meant to be comical and rage-inducing. Each tea order requires a list of steps, like adding a teabag, steeping it in water, adding sugar cubes, and a dash of milk and placing it on the tray. Couldn't even put a teabag into the damn cup, but thatâ€™s all part of the game when itâ€™s working as intended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962733287', 'num_games_owned': 2773, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1667861099}
review:
[h1]Spielbewertung von TrophyHunter[/h1]

Dieses Game habe ich mir vor einiger Zeit gemeinsam mit einem Freund gekauft, um es mal zu testen. Mein Kollege hat es dann nach kurzer Zeit wieder deinstalliert, sonst wÃ¤re er komplett ausgerastet. Im Gegensatz zu ihm habe ich zum einen mehr Geduld bei solchen Games und zum anderen hat das Spiel Errungenschaften, weshalb ich als Achievement-Farmer das Spiel durchspielen musste. Ob ich will oder nicht. Naja, nun bewerte ich dieses Game fÃ¼r euch.

"Ampu-Tea" wurde 2014 von "ProjectorGames" entwickelt. Das Spiel verwendet unkonventionelle Ideen und versucht, den Spieler mit seinem skurrilen Konzept zu Ã¼berraschen. Die Aufgabe des Spiels ist die Steuerung einer Armprothese, mit der man einen Tee zubereiten soll. Diese ungewÃ¶hnliche Spielmechanik sorgt fÃ¼r eine interessante und unvorhersehbare Spielerfahrung, welche hier und da den Spieler extrem triggern kann. Durch das ungewÃ¶hnliche Gameplay hebt sich das Spiel "Ampu-Tea" von anderen Games ab und bietet ein einzigartiges Spielerlebnis. Es ist wichtig zu erwÃ¤hnen, dass "Ampu-Tea" mÃ¶glicherweise nicht fÃ¼r jeden Spieler geeignet ist. Der absurde Humor und die ungewÃ¶hnliche, teils frustrierende Spielmechanik kann den betroffenen Spieler stark beeinflussen und wirkt sich eventuell negativ auf das Spielempfinden aus. In dem Game, gibt es einige Errungenschaften zum freischalten, welche teilweise schon sehr fragwÃ¼rdige Aufgaben erfordern. I mean, warum sollte man das Spiel 500 mal neustarten? Was hat das fÃ¼r einen Sinn? Preislich liegt das Spiel bei ungefÃ¤hr 5â‚¬ im Steamshop. Leider ist das Spiel auch nicht frei von Bugs und hat einige Ãœbersetzungsfehler, welche den SpielspaÃŸ etwas eingrenzen. Die Steuerung ist im Ã¼brigen auch nicht gerade einfach und man benÃ¶tigt etwas Zeit und GlÃ¼ck, um Ã¼berhaupt erstmal eine Tasse greifen zu kÃ¶nnen. So viel dazu.

Ich persÃ¶nlich finde, dass man durchaus mit diesem Game SpaÃŸ haben kann und vor eine kleine Challenge gestellt wird. Es ist einfach ein komplett anderes Spielkonzept, was man so von anderen Spielen kennt. Ich kann es jedenfalls empfehlen. MÃ¼sst ihr wissen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1402390688}
review:
Ampu-Tea was made in a desperate attempt to try and piggyback off of the huge(& short-lived) YouTube/streaming success of the Surgeon Simulator game when it was released almost a decade ago.

It is horrible to play and any small redeeming qualities are copied from Surgeon Simulator, Surgeon Simulator isn't particularly good to play either, it's a meme game that hit it off in funny commentary videos and streams and these developers did the laziest thing they could to try to piggy-back off of that and basically become the Surgeon Simulator 2 sensation.

[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1680897069}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223144280', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1547413204}
review: I was gifted this in like 2015 from a friend, turned out I couldn't play it since I had a mac at the time. It sat in my library for the next 5 years until I bought a windows PC and tried it. The controls stink, the graphics are crap, and the game lags as if I had 300 chrome tabs all playing "Never Gonna Give You Up" simultaneously. I can't be mad though, every time I look at this game in my library, it reminds me of my best friend and I having the times of our lives as kids, and it makes my happy. That's all, 2/10 would receive again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250673632', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1667860487}
review:
Move over, traditional tea parties! Amputea is here to add a splash of dark humor and a dash of absurdity to your usual teatime routine. If you've ever thought, "I love tea, but wouldn't it be better with a side of prosthetic limbs and quirky accidents?" â€“ well, my friend, this game is steeped just for you!

Visually, Amputea embraces its eccentric theme with a delightful blend of cartoonish characters and over-the-top tea-related mishaps. The exaggerated reactions of your tea-drinking patrons as they accidentally lose an arm or two are both cringe-worthy and absurdly hilarious. The prosthetic limbs even come in a rainbow of colors, because why settle for regular old beige when you can have a neon green robotic arm?

The soundtrack, surprisingly, isn't a series of screams but rather a jaunty, whimsical tune that plays in the background as you navigate the chaotic world of unconventional tea brewing. It's like the game is saying, "Sure, you're causing mild bodily harm, but why not enjoy some toe-tapping tunes while you're at it?"

Gameplay in Amputea is a hilarious balancing act (pun intended) of serving tea to your unsuspecting patrons while trying not to cause too much... collateral damage. The physics-based limb loss is both absurd and strangely satisfying, making every failed pour or misplaced sugar cube a source of laughter. And the more chaotic it gets, the more fun it becomes.

The progression system is a riot, with each level introducing new challenges, patrons, and even wackier ways to inadvertently dismember your customers. The variety of tea-related disasters keeps the gameplay fresh, ensuring that you never know what limb-losing shenanigans are brewing around the corner.

The community around Amputea has truly embraced the absurdity, with players sharing their most epic fails and prosthetic limb mishaps. The game's lighthearted approach to dark humor has cultivated a community that appreciates a good laugh and a cup of tea, no matter how many limbs get sacrificed in the process.

In conclusion, Amputea is a refreshing departure from your typical tea party simulator. Its eccentric theme, quirky gameplay, and darkly comedic approach make it a standout title that's sure to tickle your funny bone â€“ and maybe even detach it temporarily. So, grab your teapot and a sense of humor, because in the world of Amputea, laughter is steeped to perfection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123177904', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1637636386}
review:
One of the first games I got on Steam, and I replayed it recently for achievements, to be ultimately disappointed. It's a cute game and is obviously designed to be difficult, but it's also buggy and clunky on top of being difficult. Game crashes often, and your arm can randomly break completely at the slightest tap, forcing you to restart.
Also hate that they put in a "play the game 500 times" achievement, as I can't name a single game, even one I enjoy a lot, that I've ever opened and played over 500 times.

review:
[h1] Mediocre [/h1]

Ampu-Tea es un juego que ganÃ© en un sorteo. Ya desde que lo vi en la tienda, exclamÃ© para mis adentros : Â¿QuÃ© coj... es esto? 
Hoy llegÃ³ el infausto dÃ­a en el que he decidido probarlo.

Lo cierto es que empeora cuando lo juegas.

Ya desde el principio, el concepto es bastante absurdo e infame: Â¿Manejar un brazo robÃ³tico para preparar infusiones? 
Â¿QuiÃ©n fue el lince que ideÃ³ tal cosa? Â¿Estaba en sus cabales cuando pergeÃ±Ã³ tamaÃ±a sandez?

Y esto es el juego, ni mÃ¡s ni menos. Con una jugabilidad aberrante, unos grÃ¡ficos paleolÃ­ticos y una mÃºsica de fondo digna de un tanatorio, manejamos ( o eso se pretende) un brazo mecÃ¡nico, que flota en el aire, para tratar de realizar el tÃ­pico tÃ© inglÃ©s de las 5. Pues sÃ­... no solo conducen por la izquierda o utilizan magnitudes de medidas propias del medievo; tambiÃ©n tienen esta costumbre tan suya, que algÃºn chovinista ha pretendido inmortalizar en el mundo de los videojuegos con esta disparatada y estÃºpida propuesta que es Ampu-Tea.

Uno de los peores juegos que me he echado a la cara, sÃ³lo superado por el inigualable Reading Simulator. 
En serio... es horrendo. Al principio te hace gracia el ir desparramando por la mesa todos los enseres y utensilios de tan noble costumbre. A los 5 minutos te preguntas quÃ© demonios haces con tu vida intentando agarrar una taza con la bandera anglosajona. Mire usted si es patÃ©tico el juego, que sÃ³lo por abrirlo ya obtienes un logro.

Muy triste que lo Ãºnico bueno que tenga un juego es que se pueden obtener cromos. Este tÃ­tulo es buen ejemplo de tal cosa.

Â¿5 euros por esto?
Ni tomando un tÃ© de estramonio estarÃ­a justificado el pagar tal cantidad por esta autÃ©ntica chusta.
Casi que ni regalado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984870353', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1627937616}
review:
Where Surgeon Simulator was fun because of the chaos, this is just mildly aggravating. Go pick that up for $10 instead and get far more than half an hour's worth of game play.

Nothing spectacularly breaks or flies around the room outside of your hand when you flick the mouse too hard. Friction doesn't really work, so picking things up doesn't work outside of scooping them into your palm and sliding them off. Any stylistic charm is lost since all the assets feel like they came out of the sad corners of the Unity Asset Store. 

It isn't fun in a chaotic way, technical/difficult game way, or in a casual way either. All around it just feels like a quick cash-in on Surgeon Simulator's popularity. Do yourself a favor and skip this dud.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043135631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2248, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1472003237}
review:
The developer saw Surgeon Simulator.
And then he really tried to replicate it.
Unfortunately, it's far from being gud.
It's rage-inducing, so that's the point.
Even the trailer wants you to know it.
Do you want to rage? Buy this game!
But to be quite honest, it's not good.
It's extremely clunky to control stuff.
The blurry background is disgusting.
Everything is simply very unpolished.
Paying for this game is a wrong idea.
Even the playtime is extremely short.
The base price is 5â‚¬? What a rip-off.
I simply can't recommend this trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031762613', 'num_games_owned': 9030, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1495232750}
review:
[h1][b]Ampu-Tea[/b][/h1]
As the name implies it has something to do with tea or the cooking of hot drinks in general. You are controlling some weird prosthesis and try to make some hot drinks and try not to break too many things on the table or its sourroundings. The background is you being amputated after an accident and your first wish is to be able to cook some tea again.

Kinda neat I'd say


[h1]The Key-Mechanics:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]The Prosthesis[/b] - The playable character as said is embodied by some mechanical prosthesis controlled via several keys and your mouse.
[*][b]Cups, bowls, shelves and what not[/b] - You have several kitchen props that you need to interfer with. Pick a cup out of a shelf, place it properly on a plate, put a teabag in it and pour some cooked water over it.
[*][b]TODO-List[/b] - For each "challenge" (= tea serving) you will get different lists of what to do for your perfect drink
[*][b]Difficulties[/b] - There is a wide range of difficulty levels in this game where each level provides more complex serving processes.
[*][b]Statistics[/b] - Your task will be honored with several stats like serving time, precision / mistakes and so on.
[/list]


[h1]Physical impressions:[/h1]
The graphics actually seem to be made with a lot of blood, sweat and love. Especially those little easter-eggs to be found on several cups and so on are quite neat. The soundtrack is pretty relaxing as well and somewhat kills the frustation.

However you might need to adjust some settings in order to not fall deaf.


[h1]A personal note:[/h1]
This game is definately meant to be somewhat challenging but it is more annyoing than challenging actually. The controlls is pretty much all over the place and for some reason they thought it was a bright idea to ditch controller support at all.
The camera-perspectives combined with the physics of this game are making it pretty much impossible to be "good" in this game.

It is quite fun to play once or twice but I would never touch it again after achieving a perfect game on this one really.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Since the idea is nice actually I would rather like to recommend it but for the delivered content and the given pricetag as well as the poor controlls and physics there is no way I can say "Yes" to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260331341', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1470655404}
review:
6/10 (Long story short) Rage game where you play as a mans very-difficult-to-control robot hand trying its best to make tea.

Ampu-Tea was a fad game mad popular by YouTubers a long time ago (2013) to rage induce the masses. The controls are meant to be buggy and the game is exactly what it says it is. That being said; the gameplay will make you want to pull your hair out and wish you never downloaded it which is exactly what it aims to do. Guided by a witty brit voice it is a unique gameplay experience but it just isn't worth the price it's put at. The achievements take around 3 hrs to get but it has maybe 30 minutes of actual gameplay. My takeaway:

[u]Pros[/u]
[list]
   [*] Easy Achievements
   [*] Witty British Banter
   [*] Good Quality Overall
   [*] Mechanics Work As Designed
   [*] Trading Cards!
   [*] Actually Fun
   [*] Rewards You For Messing Up
   [*] Doesn't Take Itself Seriously
   [*] Is What It Says It Is
[/list]

[u]Cons[/u]
[list]
   [*] Simply Isn't Worth The Price
   [*] One Short Music Track That's Ehhh
   [*] Extreme Grind
   [*] Extreme Rage
   [*] Extreme Depression
   [*] Camera Viewing Angles Suck
   [*] Bugs Sometimes
[/list]

[spoiler] Watching Someone Play Is 100x Better Than Playing This Yourself [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1578856885}
review:
Well now, this was a really weird game that I had the opportunity to play. I didn't even know what it was about in the first place, I've got it for free during one of these massive giveaways, but the premise never really caught my attention.

So, overall, it doesn't offer you a story or campaign; all you've gotta do is to take control of this prosthetic arm, and do your best in order to achieve the goal of preparing and serving a cup of tea. There're three different levels of difficulty available, each one of them demanding you to add something extra to the mix.

The graphics aren't bad, they're good for what they are. The sound effects are kinda cool, but as for the music itself, it can definitely contribute to make you feel even more stressed. The controls are certainly something that it's hard to master, especially when it keeps glitching every now and then; nonetheless, since the game doesn't really have any more to offer, the difficulty serves the purpose of extending the experience.

Ok, this game definitely isn't one of the best in the world, but at least it can keep you entertained for a couple of hours, and you through the exercise of patience (and luck), you can get to unlock all the possible achievements. Yep, even that one which requires you to start the game 500 different times (thanks God somebody published a macro on the forums to assist everyone with that task).

Just to finish, make tea, not war.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073916849', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1574089655}
review:
How to make a cup of tea:
1. Pick up the tea bag.
2. Pick up the tea bag.
3. Pick up the tea bag.
4. Pick up the tea bag.
5. Put the tea bag into the cup.
6. Pick up the tea bag.
7. Wait where did the teabag go? Is it in there?
8. Pick up the tea bag.
9. Put the tea bag into the cup.
10. Oh it was already in there
11. Pick up the cup to add water
12. Get cup stuck in finger
13. Add hot water to cup
14. Attempt to remove finger from cup
15. Hand is now a drill.
16. Pick up the tea bag.
17. Remove everything from the table with drill hand
18. Close game because basically it's a mall claw game for Youtubers and you finished every achievement in about an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054061180', 'num_games_owned': 1816, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1553033904}
review:
You've got 2 hours. Impress me!

Basically Surgeon Simulator, just not as good and a lot less content. My gameplay hours are slightly below two hours, and that is because I completed the game and got all the achievements before two hours.

Score: 2/10
Gameplay: Controls are strangely placed and don't feel comfortable. Controlling the hand is difficult and funky, but that adds to the feel of the simulation. The concept of making tea is nice and the process is fine. Just not enough to do. 1/2
Graphics: Looks nice, sounds can get annoying if you play for a while. Standard Unity graphics, nothing special. The milk and water sphere's are terrible. It could have been liquid and would still have worked. 0/2
Replayability: Since you can only make tea and nothing else, there is nothing calling me back. 0/2
Unique: Not really. Surgeon Simulator was first and this is just a skinned demo of that. Adds nothing new and exciting. 0/2
Overall: If you are an achievement chaser then the game will work for you. I completed all the achievements in under two hours. Other than that it was fun to get the achievements, but I won't play the game again. 1/2

author: {'steamid': '76561198076540765', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1458399160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1550879809}
review:
For only about half an hour of gameplay it may not be worth getting for full price, but if you liked Surgeon Simulator or want to know if you would like it then this is worth considering. It's really difficult, but it's meant to be.

Pros:
- Good graphics
- Decent control over the arm, it generally goes where you direct it
- It's short, so you're finished the game before you get too frustrated

Cons:
- It seems that 'too much milk' is the default failure reason and sometimes comes up if you fail for other reasons. I failed because of that after putting only one press of milk. Finally figured out that I actually failed because you have to put the milk in after the tea & water.
- The 'clear the table' achievement was a bit finicky, and didn't pop up until the table had been cleared for a while. The first time I tried it didn't pop up at all.
- The achievement for playing the game 500 times seems pointless

Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198335475455', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1544107465}
review:
This is a simple, yet frustrating, casual game. You basically control a robot hand and try to deliver orders for different types of tea. You have to master the controls in order to do your best but it's really difficult.
Apart from this, there isn't much more to this game.
I recommend you to buy this game when it's on sale, because for 5â‚¬ it isn't worth it.
It's difficult to recommend this game, unless you really enjoy tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024812661', 'num_games_owned': 5784, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1482884416}
review:
Ampu-Tea. You're a robotic arm and your task here is to make tea by a given recipe. The catch: you control each finger of the robotic arm individually with assigned keys & mouse and that is fairly challenging.

The graphics are pleasant, the quality is good enough, price is OKish for the content it gives, but usually well discounted during sales.

Achievements are not that hard to get (I managed to unlock them all in a couple of hours).

The game is nice and really hard to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139150022', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1532560651}
review:
Lo he conseguido gratis, y aun asi me parece caro. 

Lo mejor que puedes hacer con este juego es dejarlo abierto mientras ves una pelicula, y en cuanto te den las cartas desinstalarlo, formatear el ordenador, y despues dinamitarlo. 

Musica horrible, graficos lamentables, control espantoso, jugabilidad nula... Me costaria creer si este juego costara 50 centimos, pero... 5 euros?? Por ese dinero puedes conseguir autenticas maravillas en Steam. 

Incluso las reseÃ±as positivas se burlan del juego, o valoran el poder conseguir cartas, no el juego en si. Es una de esas autenticas BASURAS que tendrian q ser eliminadas de la plataforma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205833036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1612654026}
review:
This is the kind of quirky game I enjoy playing between grinding levels and / or achievements for other, more involved games ...so ordinarily I would just love it.  

But I don't love this game. This game and I are legally separated, yet unfortunately still married. This game won't let me leave it. This game is holding me hostage because this game has a JERK achievement that has nothing to do with gameplay or skill, only pointless endurance long after all traces of the charm and fun it ever had have been slowly eroded into a fine powder of bitterness and regret I ever crossed paths with it.  Thank goodness we never had little downloadable content together!

However, if you are not OCD / a 100% cheev collector this game is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097473222', 'num_games_owned': 2748, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1507700570}
review:
Story: non Existent
Gameplay : 5/10 It was a suffering even to figure out how it works
Characters:none
Multiplayer:none
World : 5/10 - it is mostly a table and things on it
Visual 6/10 The visuals look good, but sadly I give it a 6 because it gave me a headache
Sound: 5/10I am sure it had to do something with the headache
Bugs: none
Rage: I think the game is made for you to feel it, I WAS RAGING ALL ALONG !
Price:Only if you think you are immune to headaches

I rate it a 4/10, I will recommand it only because every developer deserves some possitive feedback
It gave me over 10 hours of pain and suffering to make a single cup of tea

author: {'steamid': '76561198054982103', 'num_games_owned': 1994, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1520205222}
review: Ampu-Tea is a strange one. It's frustrating, to the MAX, especially when you compare it to making an actual cup of tea, which is approximately 46,819 times easier than this game. And why you only have 1 mechanical arm is beyond me! It's alright, probably better if you're a tea drinker, like i probably wouldn't have bought it if it was called Ampu-Coffee, because i just don't like coffee! The thing that makes it so strange, is the need to complete it. You're making a cup of tea, with a robotic arm... How difficult can it be! Then, once you're done, they throw the, "you gotta play the game 500 times to get this achievement"... 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198213494479', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1473520659}
review: Why does somebody create a game, in which the objective is to fail? And why did I bought this game? Seriously, it's just a waste of money and don't buy this piece of shit. It's just annoying because the developers thought a tutorial is unnecessary. You have no idea how to do anything and spend the first minutes finding out how to contol the hand. After you have acomplished that, you are just wasting your time by failing over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over until you finally uninstall it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396433542', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1547116300}
review:
You get to prepare one of the best drinks out there, tea. The game itself knows that it is infuriating due to its poor controls, and rewards you for messing up in the form of achievements

Ampu-Tea, a true test of ones patience - as it combines the finer things in life, such as preparing tea, with the infuriating controls of Surgeon Simulator. I must give it to the game, it is the best robotic arm tea preparer simulator.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6824, 'num_reviews': 1312, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1512135617}
review: Wanna-be simulation game made for fun and laughs - except nobody's laughting and it's $4.99. It could be interesting as a free to play demo, to run once, test and uninstall, but otherwise it's just something that's not worth anything. Don't waste your money and time on Ampu-Tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077489422', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1516648855}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993856924', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1505623260}
review: When you hate someone really bad, or just hate yourself - this is the game for you, and I DON'T mean that in a bad way.  Horrificly punishing games can be quite fun (e.g. Surgeon Simulator) esp. when playing with a friend and this one was nut-grinding, bowel-clenched fun.   I laughed like a hyena as my friend tried to make this work, then experienced instant karma as it was my turn.  I personally think that is what the game designer was going for, and they succeeded.   Find a cool friend (a very cool friend), and try it..  tho now that I have VR I wonder, could I experience this pain even deeper?

author: {'steamid': '76561198150727982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1507167978}
review:
Die Sache mit den seltsamsten Simulationsspielen ist, dass es sich wahrscheinlich um Cash-Grabs handelt und Bugs "witzig" sind.
Es ist ein $ 5 Spielzeug, also habe ich nicht wirklich viel davon erwartet. Ich stimme aber den Bewertungen zu - Ampu-Tee klang wie ein Versuch, eine gesellschaftliche Aussage zu bionischen Waffen zu machen, und stattdessen endet es, es zu verharmlosen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1510287074}
review:
Ampu-Tea, a true test of ones patience - as it combines the finer things in life, such as preparing tea, with the infuriating controls of Surgeon Simulator.

Pros:
-You get to prepare one of the best drinks out there, tea
-The game itself knows that it is infuriating due to its poor controls, and rewards you for messing up in the form of achievements
-It has trading cards 

Cons:
-No real replay value, once you've finally managed to brew that splendid cup of tea, I doubt you'd ever want to launch this game again
-Feels overpriced at R55 (~$5). 

If you enjoyed Surgeon Simulator and can get this on a sale, give it a go.
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198117837119', 'num_games_owned': 3901, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1515655330}
review:
This game is worthy for owning, but it doesn't offer much.

This game works the same as Surgeon Simulator in the case where you control one hand and its fingers in order to do its task, in this case, make a cup of tea. The gameplay feels fairly smooth and the physics are pretty responsive.

Other than making tea and wreaking the table, there's not much else to this game. Once you make your cup of tea, you've completed most of the Steam Achievements. If you can get this in a bundle or for really cheap, I highly suggest you play this game. Otherwise, it's not really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006960163', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1563949760}
review:
I must give it to the game, it is the best robotic arm tea preparer simulator.
But Controls are really funky. I have big hands and i still find it weird you have to press Q W E R to grab, but also Left shift to half clinch. There are many other buttons, you know XD. OR make the grabbing a bit easier. Thumb and index finger do not flinch in sync, makes it ridiculously hard to grab objects like tea bags or sugar cubes. But overall its a fun game, doesn't have much of a replay-ability.

Also, makes my GTX 1080 and 7700K go ape sh!t for some reason, even tho graphics are not jaw dropping XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198086549747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1628231253}
review:
Truly, truly, I say to you, this game is like no other! It is a masterpiece of game design, as well as having the most fantastic fictional story line ever devised in the history of everything. The goal of the game is to make tea, with a robotic arm. Short, sweet, and to the point. A wonderous game to play on a quiet, tea-utiful day.


 I give this game Te(a)n out of Te(a)n cups of wonderous earl grey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027991918', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1453345519}
review:
Ampu-Tea is a great game to sit down with friends and family at home and see who can make a tea the fastest in this game where you control a hand that does everything. Get ready to re learn how to work that hand and be prepared to maybe even get a little frustrated as making tea in this game is not a simple task but it def does feel good once you have made a tea with perfection. Grab this game on sale if you want to have a fun time yelling and raging as you try to make a tea. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982851066', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1511274040}
review:
Horrifyingly bad game. I've played several games with the mechanics like this, having to precisely control something to complete a task, however, this game is just bad. The "mechanical" arm looks like a joke and functions like one as well, barely managing to grab something and hold on to it. Then even if you can grab something, the slightest touch can send something flying off the table. It's just not fun when you're supposed to be making tea and the tea bag just BARELY fits into the teabag, making it so you have to make sure you're dropping it in the perfect place to fit, which the camera controls are so wonky that it makes even that difficult.

Don't waste your money, if you want to see how bad it really is, wait to get it in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1510797240}
review:
Tags: Simulator - Clumsy/Humor
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Second only to Surgeon Simulator. It still lacks rather far behind in overall quality. The camera angle is odd. Controls are poor on purpose and the lack of catastrophic bloody failures is boring.

The idea to include a robot arm and the british slant was a stroke of genius. However the blurry outlines and lack of care for environment makes it just about on par with Tea Party Simulator 2015 which had relaxing outdoor areas to picnic in. Instead of this obvious 3D engine room with bare assets. Recommend you stick to Surgeon Simulator. This is not a genre that needs lesser copycats and now that VR is out the last thing you want is a desktop game where you only control a floating arm.
http://store.steampowered.com/app/233720/Surgeon_Simulator_2013/

review:
A nice little game ,not too much to do, besides learning the *great* controls.

The achievments are not too hard ,that's always a plus in these types of games.

If you're looking to challenge yourself for a short while ,then this might be for you.

Overall:5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143610563', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1514918943}
review:
[h1][u]Ampu-Tea[/u][/h1]

[h1][u]The Good[/u][/h1]
[i]+Funny concept.[/i]

[h1][u]The Bad[/u][/h1]
[i]-Really glitchy.
-Items are shaped in a way that makes them almost impossible to be picked up.
-Boring even if it did work.[/i]

[h1][u]Conclusion[/u][/h1]
[i]Got in a bundle. Unlike other games of the "make it ridiculously hard to complete basic tasks" genre (if you can call it a genre) this one feels unfinished and glitchy. The things you need to pick up are not shaped in a way that alows them to be picked up easily. It feels untested and the margin for error is tiny. The cards are all it was good for.[/i]

[h1][u]Score[/u][/h1] 
[i]3/10[/i]

[h1][u]Buy At Full Price Or Wait For A Sale?[/u][/h1]
[i]Don't buy it at all.[/i]

Got in a bundle. Unlike other games of the "make it ridiculously hard to complete basic tasks" genre (if you can call it a genre) this one feels unfinished and glitchy. The things you need to pick up are not shaped in a way that alows them to be picked up easily. It feels untested and the margin for error is tiny. The cards are all it was good for.

HumdrumAnt

review:
Ampu-Tea

 It allows us to devote time to other British pursuits, like apologising or being flooded. You put the bag in the water and then you have tea. All you need is patience and working limbs.Itâ€™s like Surgeon Simulator, but with mugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1505339176}
review:
"Ampu-Tea" ist ein Tee-Mach Spielchen im Stile des Surgeon Simulator.

Wir wollen uns einen Tee machen. Dummerweise haben wir nur eine sehr eigenwillig zu steuernde und extrem sensible Roboterhand.

Und das war auch schon das ganze Spiel. Wir sehen den Tisch aus einer eher ungÃ¼nstigen SchrÃ¤gperspektive und mÃ¼ssen erstmal eine Tasse greifen. Was aufgrund der absurd sensiblen Steuerung schon eine Herausforderung ist. Dann den Teebeutel greifen, der einem stÃ¤ndig durch die Roboterfinger glitcht, heiÃŸes Wasser, vielleicht noch Milch oder Zucker und fertig ist der Tee.

Das Game ist ein Physik-Gag-Gamechen. War das beim Surgeon-Simulator noch leidlich unterhaltsam, wird es hier so spannend wir Teekochen. Es gibt keine anderen Modi, die Musik ist extrem dudelig und die Grafik hat auch schonmal bessere Zeiten gesehen.

SpaÃŸ bereitet das Ganze etwa drei bis fÃ¼nf Minuten, ziemlich genau so lange wie ein guter Darjeeling ziehen muÃŸ.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
5/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
-/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
3/10 Sound
3/10 Spielmechanik
4/10 Balancing
4/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Das Spiel hat einen im Tee.

[h1][b]4/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198118273560', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1590018455}
review: To be honest I hate this game, and at first it was a bad hate. But recently I've been thinking "Robert, the game wasn't super bad. You've been given worse games." And I'm right, I have received worse games. The game knows it's downright unplayable and rewards you for getting angry after failing to pick up the cup... and for knocking the cups off. I did have fun tfying to make tea and the sense of accomplishment for finally doing it was great. So while I recommend it, I also don't. Buying it is your choice.

review: An oddity I got in a game bundle. If you think this is a game go and make yourself a cup of tea, because that is what the "game" is. Also it is not what I would consider fun and its kinda glitchy I ended putting the arm through a table cloth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985548572', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1506881682}
review:
Can't recommend it. Feels very cheap, the shadows of objects pass through the tabletop and show on the floor, you can leave the kitchen into some kind of afterlife limbo place, menu and interface aren't well designed, the achievements bug often and are delayed, and there's one where you have to open the game 500 times which is a drag for achievement players. I can't recommend this unless you're a die hard amputee and tea fan, and even then only pick this up on sale.

3 teas out of 10 amputees

author: {'steamid': '76561198101487603', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1515375050}
review: Simplemente genial, las risas que te puedes echar mientras intentas agarrar la taza sin tirar la estanteria entera o echando el azucar no tiene precio. Los logros son bastante sencilllitos, aunque requieren algo de paciencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029347976', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1506341450}
review:
This game is absolute garbage.

Its like the developer has never seen an actual hand let alone a mechanical hand.
The fingers act like limp noodles, making picking ANYTHING up a massive challenge. 

The game is buggy as hell so if you do somehow get close to beating it, theres a 50% chance the hand will 'break' and flail around.

0/10
Ide ask for a refund even if the game was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971570182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1506780686}
review:
A ver....es malo,pareceque la tazas estan gravedad cero,y el angulo de vision complica a dios hacer nada,aparte de que parece que esta hecho con juego y tira millas.

Ademas de que los controles han sido creados por satanas por lo menos...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073261388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1504402538}
review: This game is an unholy challenge. Harder than surgeon simulator, with fingers somehow less useful than actual sausages taped to my hands would be. That said, when you get anything done, the feeling of satisfaction is unparalelled. Do be aware that some mechanics don't work correctly and that can be frustrating. I bought it on sale and it was like 2 dollars, and at that price, I would buy it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989421071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1506011072}
review:
1/10 amputed fun

A funny-sounding idea ....but the game cannot deliver anything that is actually fun to play. 

If you try to take the game seriously (instead of simply using the robot hand to wreak havoc in your tea making spot) it gets extremly annoying in no time. The visual presentation and sounds are ok though.

Time to uninstall the game and fix myself a real cup of tea....

author: {'steamid': '76561197991804245', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1505509707}
review: This game was made with some involvement by youtube personality Keemstar, who called a much more talented developer a "mentally challenged entitled piece of shit" for not wanting their company's product associated with another influencer with millions of subscribers who thought saying the N-word (with a hard "-er") on a stream watched by thousands was an appropriate use of his platform, contributing to the review bombing of their game which, by the way, is better than Ampu-Tea. Ampu-Tea is a mediocre tech demo and making it doesn't entitle a developer to calling another developer a piece of shit.ï»¿ Not worth playing, and especially not worth supporting the developer until they stop tolerating Keemstar's actions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992497887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1535933808}
review:
I've not played surgeon simulator or some of the others so this is my first go at these types of games.
I have to say I didn't mind it, i mean it doesn't have too much replay value as once you've managed to get to grips with the initially daunting controls its fairly easy. Got it as part of a bundle so all in all its not bad think i'd think differently if i'd paid a few quid for it though.
Give it a go if you like these sort of games and its worth a look if you've never played these types of games and its really cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981127270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1503307852}
review:
It's kind of bad. Got the hang of it quick, but problems with the game itself weren't endearing at all. I got the teabag into the cup with no real issue, but it wouldn't fall into the cup, it just floated there on top, moved the cup over to the water (grabbing the handle even), tried to get the bag to go into the cup, physics engine flipped out, teabag flew, ALT+F4. 
 
I see what they were doing here, and I really do respect the effort I'm sure went into the game. For $5? Maybe not, but if it's on a sale or part of a bundle, it's worth checking out at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218755656', 'num_games_owned': 1524, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1682706464}
review:
edit: ignore my previous review, this game is straight garbage. idk what tf i was on when i wrote that 

---

What in the actual heck even is this game?
A racial stereotype, mocking the simple ways of us kinder British folk?

No.
No, that's not right. Not right at all, dear chap. Let's get out a cuppa and talk about this game.

This is a game, apparently. It's... Certainly something. Ampu-Tea is a frustratingly fun puzzle game wherein you attempt to assemble the Great British Beverage according to an order on the mystical blackboard, by manipulating a poorly-mapped prosthetic limb. 
The controls on this game, while somewhat obnoxious to grasp, offer solid means for grabbing, prodding, turning and even impromptu profanity. They could certainly do with improving if you want to make the game more accessible and enjoyable, but I genuinely believe the difficult control mechanisms are what make this game so frustratingly fun.

As a party game, it's fantastic. Gather your friends and have a giggle as you struggle to undertake even the most simple tasks with your new, blue, robotic prosthetic.
Picture the scene; it's a family Christmas. Eight of you are gathered around the fire, with little Timmy being the bored brat he is. "Hey, twinblade, can we have something to do?". 
Shut up Timmy. 
Nobody likes you. 
But ugh, fine. Your father knows how to make a good cup of tea, and I'm a lazy twonk. Uncle Rodney always made a killer brew.
"Fine." I mutter, turning on the computer to boot up this masterpiece of software engineering.
At first, people are confused. Scared even. They don't know what to make of it. But soon, soon they'll understand the wonders of Ampu-Tea.
Aunt Greta goes first. She Falcon Punches the mug straight through and ends up flipping the table. I hope there's no cats in this game, because they wouldn't be Schrodinger's cat. I can personally confirm with the ammount of stuff that went flying, it would certainly be dead.
Great Grandpa Booboo wasn't much better. Despite his real-world experience with a prosthetic limb, he flailed around in this game like a hamster on LSD. Weak.
The annoying little stain that is Timothy screeches for his turn. Ugh, I wish I was home.
Wait.
I am home. I wish these other people were at home. Not my home, though. This is my fortress of solitude.
Timmy tries to play the game, but he's like six so doesn't understand what on earth he's meant to be doing. It's okay though, because everyone is laughing. 
Grandpa laughs.
Auntie laughs.
The clock laughs.
I shoot the clock.
Timothy starts crying again. He's always crying. Just ignore him.

Overall, I would certainly reccommend this game to anyone who needs a time-filler for a group of friends. 
I personally found it saddeningly frustrating when played alone, though some of you might prefer games which deepen the void of eternal depression and that's okay.

One final thing:

If any of you put the milk in first, I'm disowning you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1418215076}
review:
Ampu-Tea is a game was inspired by Surgeon Simulator. Yes, its that hard aswell, but surgeon simulator more player friendly, more playable and include more content.

There is one goal in Ampu-Tea: yes, to make a cup of tea. Sounds easy right? yes it is IRL. If it would be this hard to create a cup of tea irl then the brittish empire would have never interested in colonizing/conquerion indian ocean region including India.

The engine is bad, buggy and some of the achievements are annoying. Also, its way too expensive for the content and gameplay it offers, i believe review would be still negative if it would be 0,99 tho.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill share some informations about achievements:
11 steam achievements and most of them annoying. i mean, most of them awarded for creating a cup of tea, some of the awarded to trying to create but in wrong order, but the point of the start the game 500 times is just stupid. Its still not a hard game to perfect it, but definetly not a fun game.
Time to 100%: 2-3h

author: {'steamid': '76561198121856929', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1501627451}
review: Small, funny game. It gets funnier if you play with someone sitting with you and you can come up with jokes and make fun of each others fancy tea making skills. I like those "clumsy" games to be honest. Would not pay original price tho and the achievement that asks you to play 500 times is ridiculous. Would not recommend to people who take those too seriously, this game is all about how fun you can make it for yourself. Have some humor and a friend and you will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120632907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1499199198}
review:
[h1] Ampu-Tea	[/h1]
[b] Pros: [/b]
+ Cool Idea
+ Tea

[b] Cons: [/b]
- Overpriced
- Lack Of Content. Needs More Things To Do
- Lots Of Rage Quits
- Grindy Achievement

[b] Review: [/b]
Ampu-Tea has a cool idea for a game. Use a robot arm to make a cup of tea; sounds easy but it is not. This game requires patients and time. One of the achievements is to play the game 500 times which is just annoying. The controls are frustrating which is probably how it is suppose to be but just becomes very annoying. It's not a bad little game but it's very overpriced for how much of a game is there. I would recommend this game when it's on sale by at least 75% or higher.

[b] This was Curated for PC Beta Gaming if you would like to follow us the link is below: [/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PC-BetaG#curation

This review is just my opinion. If you liked this review please give it a thumbs up. Thank you for reading my review. If you would like to see more of my reviews the link is below: 
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198120632907/recommended/?p=1

review:
Analisis de Amputea:

El juego va literalmente de controlar una mano robotica que deberÃ¡s llevar al milimetro con teclado y ratÃ³n, cualquier movimiento en falso y adios a tÃº te, si quieres jugar a este juego armate de paciencia primero, si careces de ella mejor ni lo intentes, puede llegar a ser a veces desesperante.

Pros: 
Te recordara al surgeon simulator por sus controles.
Entretenido.
Desestresante, si te cabreas mucho coje el brazo y manda la mesa a la mierda.

Contras:
Los controles no responden lo bien que deberian.
Puede llegar a hacerse monotono puesto que hay que repetir accines casi siempre.
Poca rejugabilidad, es cierto que cada vez te piden un te distinto pero eso no cambia los pasos que haces siempre.

Lo recomiendo? Bueno, si tienes ganas de jugarlo espera a que este rebajadoa un euro o dos como mucho o buscalo en alguna pagina de manera gratuita, seguro que aun abundan por ahÃ­ alguna key es entretenido pero no te darÃ¡ mas de un par de horas de diversion, ah y tienen cromos :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198013429772', 'num_games_owned': 2524, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1493172101}
review:
Game crashes on a Windows 7 (fresh install) system that is powered by an i7-6700, 16GB DDR4 and Nvidia GTX1060 6GB, however the game runs no problems in windowed mode but with one major exception and that is the mouse cursor in windowed mode is not constrained to within the game window which is problematic for anyone who wants to take this video game somewhat seriously.

This is a game I can recommend to those people who love rage inducing difficult-as video games but not until the above two issues (crash at startup and unconstrained mouse cursor in windowed mode) are resolved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117179038', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1590115561}
review:
[h1]What the game is[/h1]
[i]Apmu-Tea[/i] is both a game about tea and a play on words. In the game, you play as an Amputee, who has to make tea. Its a basic concept, but the game turns this concept into a challange. AS the steam page says, the game is literally surgion simulator like, but to make tea.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Game has decent graphics. 
Not state of the art, but not shitty either
+Gameplay is engaging. 
Until you figure everything out and beat the game.
+Difficult, but not too much.
It is difficult at first to do anything. Want to grab a cup, all the others get pushed off the table and onto the floor. Although over time it does go away as you learn the controls.
+Sound/Music isnt bad.
Sure the music can get annoying after a bit but the sounds go with the art style.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Not to much to do.
The concept of the game is to make tea, and thats all you do. It gets old after a while.
-Annoying controls.
The controls take a while to get used to, and by defealt they are annoying and difficult to use.

[h1]Final Opinion[/h1]
[i]Ampu-Tea[/i] is a fun game that can occupy a few hours of time. Its a basic puzzle/physics game (in my mind du to difficulty) that is only somewhat worth the price. For the current $5 it costs, I would only reccomend it if you have spare change and dont mind a challange. But if [i]Apmu-Tea[/i] is on sale, get it. The game is deffinatly something that can liven up your steam library, and as i've said before, can occupy a few hours of time.

review:
[h1]AnÃ¡lisis de Ampu-Tea: [/h1]

Nos encontramos ante un minijuego que nos propone hacer un tÃ© con una mano robÃ³tica, pero las cosas no serÃ¡n tan fÃ¡ciles al comprobar que dicha mano serÃ¡ muy ortopÃ©dica y para tener Ã©xito deberemos tener un pulso de hierro. Cualquier movimiento milimÃ©trico no calculado podrÃ­a dar al traste con nuestro proyecto de tÃ©, por lo que cualquier jugador con poca paciencia puede optar por otros juegos. No obstante, los amantes de los retos estÃ¡n de enhorabuena, que deberÃ¡n incluso lidiar con unos dedos robÃ³ticos que pueden quedarse atascados (frustrando nuestro tÃ©). Estos atascamientos hacen a veces dudar si son un fallo de programaciÃ³n o una forma por parte de los creadores para hacer mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles las cosas a los jugadores. 

Mi voto negativo se debe esencialmente a su precio, el contenido del juego no compensa los 5 euros que vale, como he dicho, se trata de un minijuego con un solo objetivo, sin nada especial ni mayores complicaciones y que desquiciarÃ¡ a muchos jugadores. 

[h1]Lo mejor: [/h1]

-El reto que supone.
-Si te propones sacar algunos logros puede ser divertido. 
-Tiene cromos. 

[h1]Lo peor: [/h1]

-No merece el precio que vale. 
-LlegarÃ¡ a ser desquiciante para una gran parte de jugadores. 
-El logro "Obsessive Tea Drinker" era innecesario.

[b]ConclusiÃ³n: [/b] No es un desastre de juego, sino que su precio no lo merece. Pero puede merecer la pena pensÃ¡rselo si lo adquirÃ­s a un buen precio menor de un euro durante alguna rebaja.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2061, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1488815630}
review:
I can't really recommend this game. While the surgeon simulator inspiration is easily noticeable, I feel it lacks a certain charm to it. The controls feel weird to begin with, and the camera angle doesn't really help. Not to mention that the robot arm tends to glitch out, especially when grabbing objects, which can lead to situations in which your hand gets stuck into certain items, and you pretty much have to restart, or have a lot of patience to get the hand out. This can lead to a lot of frustration, and, even though it's still a relatively easy 100%, when it comes to achievements (it shouldn't take you more than an hour or so), it's still not enjoyable.

All in all, I think what this game needs is some more polish. Ironing out some of the bugs, that kind of stuff. Even then, I don't feel I'd actually recommend it, which is why I'm giving it a thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998723658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1492349756}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
make tea using one hand? wtf? and all the objects in the game acts as if they're weight less, slightest bump sends them rolling

[h1]Controls[/h1]
there's a slight lag in input, and there's mouse accelerations, fine movements are pretty impossible unless you're patient.
and the hand you're controlling is a left hand, but the objects are placed more suitable for right hands.

[h1]TLDR[/h1]
the game is complete BS, it's as if it's made to be a joke.
not to mention it's porrly optimized, GTX1060 and it's lagging.... wtf
oh, and the music is so repetitive it's annoying

author: {'steamid': '76561198188653543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1483748882}
review:
You control a floating cybernetic arm and must make and serve a cup of tea. The physics are pretty decent; the game is very obviously inspired by Surgeon Simulator (luckily, your cup of tea can't bleed out on the operating table). There is one song and it's nice, but once it ends, there is just silence other than the whirring of your hand motors. You can change the difficulty level by choosing whether or not the tea gets milk or sugar, but other than that, there isn't much variation in the game play. Once you made a cuppa, that's pretty much all there is to this game.

Recommended if on sale/bundled, but NOT at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068828978', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1419438727}
review:
[code]A wonky physics simulator probably inspired by [i]Surgeon Simulator[/i], but far less charming. Players will have to attempt to make the "perfect" cup of tea through the use of a wobbly and unreliable prosthetic arm. There's nothing more and nothing less to the game itself, other than the unfortunate wordplay choice for the title. 

All in all, it's more of a challenging/frustrating pastime to kill a few hours while you're multitasking than anything else.[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1482370843}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Making-tea Simulation game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There are many resolution sizes available.
You are able to play fullscreen or windowed mode.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

First of all... i can't believe i am playing one of these pay-bait games..  But as expected. The game has terrible control movements. But that is how the game works.. You are playing with some kind of robot arm.. picking up things and trying to make tea. I have no idea how this robot arm got so messed up but it will make your life 10x harder to complete the tea. There are some different difficulties available to have more ingredients and objectives to complete a tea. You can smash up the objects if you really want too or just simply fly out of the level.  

Has some difficulty levels.
Super repetitive.
Music is pretty Meh.
You are able to reset the game.
You are able to toggle the hints button.
You have seen everything in the next 5-10 minutes and gets dull.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

All of these "simulator" games socks ass. They aren't fun and they only have one purpose, milking the customers.. These type of games are already old and it's all the same. You do this for 5 minutes and that is the game...

-------------------

I Give this game a 2/10

A falta de feedback adequado dos controles torna difÃ­cil saber se vocÃª estÃ¡ realizando corretamente as aÃ§Ãµes dentro do jogo, resultando em um sentimento de confusÃ£o e desorientaÃ§Ã£o.

AlÃ©m disso, a falta de um objetivo claro e recompensas significativas tambÃ©m prejudica a experiÃªncia. O jogo parece mais um experimento ou uma demonstraÃ§Ã£o conceitual do que um jogo completo. A ausÃªncia de um enredo cativante ou de desafios bem estruturados torna difÃ­cil manter o interesse do jogador ao longo do tempo.

Os grÃ¡ficos e a estÃ©tica geral tambÃ©m sÃ£o decepcionantes. Os visuais sÃ£o simples e pouco detalhados, nÃ£o oferecendo uma experiÃªncia visual agradÃ¡vel. A falta de polimento e o design desajeitado em certos aspectos do jogo contribuem para uma sensaÃ§Ã£o geral de baixa qualidade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1480325166}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 3.4h (based on steam).
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] Yes (1 achievement; there is a way to speed it up, but it still takes around 1.5h).
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] Yes (7 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] Yes (1 achievement; can be more or less based on your patience).
[b]Developer Response:[/b] No (last response is in 12 Jun 2014, i think).

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Ampu-Tea is a prosthetic hand simulator game to make a tea. Well, actually you can choose whethemaking a tea or screwing things up like flipping a table.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
This game is using 3D models and while i think that the help image looks great, the other does not. I think that it's still okay for such a cheap game though. I also want to add that the hot water and milk dispenser doesn't look informative enough. I don't know how to use it if i didn't watch a video for it. I even thought that i have to rotate the thing below the button which i think is a nightmare if i really have to do it.

[h1]Music[/h1]
The music has a relaxing tone and is forgettable. I forgot how the music is right after i close the game. All sfxs are used appropriately.

[h1]The game[/h1]
I have a trouble in running the game in the first 30 minutes. I even have to restart my PC just to play it. The game will start in a main menu with a language select screen. After you select the language, the game will start. All controls are easy to understand but it's hard to be applied into the game. I don't know that you can turn the palm up and down after a few minutes.

Even if you understand the controls, it's really hard to control the hand. Sometimes, the prosthetic will also move by itself (even if you don't move your mouse) after or when you are doing something. The hand itself also can't hold anything (even the hot water paper) and you can only hold the glass after sticking your hand to the glass' handle. Well, you actually can try to do it the other way, but you'll more likely fail to do it. This will become nightmare when you're trying to take a teabag or sugar. Luckily, the hand is sticky enough that the item will stick to your hand when it seems like you are not holding it. I also want to add that the same thing applies to the glass so you'll more likely have a hard time to take it off from your hand.

The game itself can't really be completed unless you are patient enough and you'll obviously need to replay it a lot of times. Sadly, there is no reward after you complete the game. After you put the tea in the tray, there is nothing happening which make it seems like you have to make another tea.

Pros:
- If you think that getting frustated counts as one, so be it.

Cons:
- No ending
- Weak hand
- Sticky hand

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is a prosthetic simulator game, although i can't really say that it's a simulator for the said thing because all you get is frustation in doing a simple task.

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]No.[/b]
[i]Unless you want to get frustated when you are playing a game, that is.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198081131328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1474774962}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048637210', 'num_games_owned': 2835, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1470563056}
review:
The intro to the game is ear blistering, so please be aware of how loud it is.

Story:
There isn't one, other than to make tea for a mysterious person.

Gameplay:
Frustrating, as your hand will break most of the time. Which was the biggest reason I closed the game many times and had to come back to it.

Sound:
Sometimes wouldn't work and I would have silence. The main screen plates and cup breaking is very loud and I had to either mute the game, lower the volume or take my head phones off.

Replayabilty:
There is none. Once you beat it, that's about it for me.

Achievements:
They aren't hard to get, just annoying as you need to open the game 500 times to 100% the game.



Overall the game is annoying and not worth playing more than once or after completing the achievements for the game. One of the quickest games I uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093571585', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1473597536}
review:
A game where you make tea there is nothing more relaxing than that right? Wrong. Its a rage game but in the most british way you can experience it.

Like in the most games in this genre you are one arm with the terrible habit of being clumsy. So while you make a warm cup of tea you drop the sugar, spill tea, break your arm, break the cup(s) and more ways to ruin your perfect cup of tea

What i think of this game? I flipped a table or two.
[spoiler]Cheers[/spoiler]

review:
The worst cup of tea ever made!
I can't believe this is actually a game.
While the idea is good in theory, it is very poor in practise
Pros: easy achievements and trading cards
Cons: You could have played a more meaningful game and enjoyed something much better instead
If you still like to buy this game, I recommend to wait until it is 90% off

author: {'steamid': '76561198053104905', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1686651816}
review:
I honestly don't know what I was expecting with a PUN-ishing name like that. It has a Surgeon Simulator feel while lacking any real mission besides slamming around objects like a 10-year old after drinking a single can of Monster Energy Drink. Of course, the only thing stopping you from doing this sort of thing forever is how easy it is to break the prosthetic arm and the desire you get after a couple of minutes to play a better game. All-in-all, I wouldn't recommend this if you're over the age of 10.

'Nough said.

review:
Ni la tematica del juego es buena, ni el juego en si, como simulador esta muy mal hecho; empezemos por la grafica, tiene una grafica pesima, se que los graficos no hacen al juego pero en serio, ese brazo robotico se ve muy feo, aparte que las fisicas de esa mano robotica son pesimas, los controles estan bien orientados pero son o muy sensibles, o demasiado rigidios, lo unico bueno que tiene este juego es la musica que ponen de fondo.
 En sintesis, este juego no vale lo poco de dinero que cobran por el, deberia estar gratis y como version de prueba, aun le falta mucho para poder ser comercializado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1470424612}
review:
[h1]Fun concept, flawed execution[/h1]
This is a game where you make tea. You control a robo-arm and must pick up a teabag, put it in a cup, add hot water, then include any other stuff as instructed by a piece of paper, like sugar or milk. It sounded fun to me because I thought controlling the robo-arm would be amusing and challenging to some degree; unfortunately the controls, mouse feedback, and just about everything else actually, are way too broken for this game to be playable or taken seriously.

[b][u]Some of the flaws[/u][/b]

[h1]1) Objects weigh too little[/h1]
Everything is as light as a feather. So when you even [i]slightly touch[/i] them, they start to topple. This includes the hot water dispenser which is a huge bulky object. The "lightness" makes it virtually impossible to do anything.

[h1]2) The mouse is far too sensitive[/h1]
Moving even 1mm [i](yes, you heard right - that's millimetres we're talking about)[/i] with your mouse results in a HUGE movement by the robo-arm, so much so that it's nigh impossible to move properly. You practically have to "tiptoe" with your mouse movement - like maybe 0.1mm or less per move. The same thing happens if you move too fast - the arm will zoom rapidly, knocking down everything in its path.

[h1]3) The fingers cannot grip properly[/h1]
Forget trying to actually pick up the teacup or anything else for that matter - the hand and its fingers are practically useless - too "weak", and most of the time not angled correctly (wrist rotation only works sideways and not vertically). You'll have better luck with one of those claw machines in the arcade.

[h1]4) Buggy as hell[/h1]
I managed to get a teabag into the teacup by pure luck. It was precariously balancing near the cup's edge, so I nudged it a little to make it enter the cup properly. Said teabag then "floated" in the centre of the cup - I made a screenshot of it (check my screenshots). And on another occasion, the British flag on the table got "impaled" by my fingers, so I ended up having to drag it around with me.

[h1]You're better off just smashing everything[/h1]
Which is what I did, in total and utter frustration. The game ends if your robo-arm gets destroyed. Thank goodness.
